wiki_catalogs.name: Introduction
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the introduction focused on the vue-cursor-rules project. Explain its purpose as a collection of AI-assisted development rules for Vue 3 applications within the Cursor IDE. Describe how it enforces best practices in TypeScript, performance, accessibility, security, and state management while optimizing token usage for AI development costs. Provide a high-level overview of the architecture as a rule-based system organized by domain categories. Include the value proposition for developers and teams seeking to improve code quality and development velocity. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as 'Composition API', 'Pinia', and 'token discipline'. Highlight integration with Cursor IDE and reference real-world use cases demonstrated in examples. Address prerequisites like Vue 3 and TypeScript knowledge. Link to key features and guide readers toward the Quick Start section.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration Options
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for all configuration options available in the project, derived from package.json. Detail each npm script (lint:rules, measure:tokens, validate, test:sample, build:docs, dev:sample, setup:sample, release variants) with their purpose, execution context, and integration into development workflows. Explain engine requirements (Node >=16.0.0, npm >=8.0.0) and their impact on compatibility. Document file inclusions in the 'files' array and how they affect distribution. Provide practical examples of extending or customizing scripts for different environments. Include troubleshooting tips for common configuration issues such as missing dependencies or version mismatches. Link to relevant rule categories where configurations enforce specific patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Basic Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Basic Component Architecture section focused on demonstrating proper Vue 3 Composition API usage with TypeScript. Analyze basic-component.vue to explain how props are typed using interface definitions, how defineProps and defineEmits provide type-safe component APIs, and how reactive state is managed within script setup. Document the use of withDefaults for optional prop handling and event emission patterns. Provide line-by-line breakdowns of key syntax including the use of loading state and button disable logic. Illustrate how this pattern promotes reusability and maintainability in Vue components. Include guidance on extending this base structure for more complex scenarios such as dynamic styling or accessibility enhancements. Address common mistakes like improper typing or missing prop validation, and show how the rule system prevents these issues. Make content accessible to beginners while highlighting advanced TypeScript integration techniques for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Vue 3 Patterns
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Vue 3 Patterns rule category. Explain how these rules enforce best practices in Vue 3 development using the Composition API, component architecture, and lifecycle management. Document specific patterns such as correct usage of ref(), reactive(), computed(), and lifecycle hooks like onMounted() and onUnmounted(). Include practical examples demonstrating proper composition function structure and reusability. Address common anti-patterns like inline lambdas in templates or misusing provide/inject. Explain integration with other categories—e.g., how TypeScript rules enhance type safety within composition functions. Provide guidance on organizing complex components and optimizing reactivity. Include troubleshooting tips for reactivity issues and performance gotchas.

wiki_catalogs.name: Quick Start Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Quick Start Guide focused on installing and activating the vue-cursor-rules in a Vue 3 project. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up the .cursor/rules directory (even though it's not accessible in current context), configuring Cursor IDE, and validating the installation. Include basic usage patterns such as triggering AI suggestions and interpreting rule-based feedback. Use concrete examples from the provided documentation files to illustrate initial configuration. Explain the relationship between rule categories and developer workflow. Address common setup issues such as incorrect paths or missing dependencies. Offer troubleshooting tips for when rules don't appear in Cursor. Keep explanations beginner-friendly while providing enough technical depth for immediate implementation.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Framework Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content on integrating multiple UI frameworks within Vue 3 applications using the provided rules. Cover supported frameworks including Vuetify, Ant Design Vue, Element Plus, Naive UI, PrimeVue, and Quasar, with emphasis on safe mixing strategies from UI_KITS_MIXING.md. Explain architectural considerations when combining frameworks, such as CSS collision avoidance, component naming conflicts, and bundle size optimization. Provide concrete code examples demonstrating proper implementation patterns. Address performance implications and accessibility consistency across mixed frameworks. Include guidance on theme unification, icon set management, and responsive behavior harmonization. Document limitations and recommended combinations based on real-world use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Handling and Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Form Handling and Validation section focused on secure, accessible form implementation patterns. Analyze form-component.vue to demonstrate real-time validation using watchers, computed validity states, and error message rendering. Explain how reactive objects manage form data and errors, and how input bindings integrate with validation functions. Document the use of scoped styles for visual feedback on invalid fields and disabled submit buttons. Highlight accessibility features including labeled inputs and ARIA-compatible error messaging. Show how the handleSubmit method orchestrates validation execution and submission flow while managing loading states. Provide practical examples of extending this pattern with additional field types, custom validators, or async validation. Address common anti-patterns such as inline validation logic or uncontrolled error states, and explain how the rules enforce better practices. Include performance considerations around watcher usage and reactivity overhead. Make content approachable for newcomers while offering depth for experts implementing complex forms.

wiki_catalogs.name: TypeScript Safety
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the TypeScript Safety rule category. Thoroughly explain how these rules enforce strict typing, interface usage, and type narrowing in Vue 3 applications. Cover implementation details including proper type annotations for props, emits, and composables. Include concrete examples from inferred rule logic showing how to define generic composables and avoid 'any' types. Document integration with Vue's typing system, especially with defineProps and defineEmits. Explain relationships with Vue 3 Patterns and how type safety improves maintainability. Address common issues like type assertion misuse and provide solutions. Include performance considerations such as compile-time impact of complex types.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rule Categories
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Rule Categories section, serving as the core of the documentation. Organize by major domains: Vue 3 Patterns, TypeScript Safety, Performance Optimization, Accessibility, Security, State Management, API Integration, Internationalization, UI Frameworks, and Budget Optimization. For each category, explain its purpose, architectural role in the rule system, and impact on development outcomes. Document implementation patterns using examples from actual rule logic (inferred from project structure). Include practical usage scenarios, such as how Composition API rules enforce proper ref() and reactive() usage. Explain relationships between categories—e.g., how TypeScript rules complement Vue 3 patterns. Provide guidance on prioritizing rule adoption based on project needs. Address configuration options if available within rule files.

wiki_catalogs.name: Features Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a structured overview of all supported features documented in FEATURES.md. Organize by functional domains: Vue 3 Patterns, TypeScript Safety, Performance Optimization, Accessibility Compliance, Security Best Practices, State Management with Pinia, API Integration via Axios, Internationalization with Vue I18n, and Budget Optimization for AI token usage. For each feature, explain its value proposition, implementation scope, and alignment with production-ready development standards. Include cross-references to corresponding rule files and example implementations. Highlight unique capabilities enabled by Cursor IDE integration. Ensure content serves both quick scanning and deeper technical exploration, with links to advanced sections where applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration with Composables
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the API Integration with Composables section focused on reusable, type-safe API interaction patterns using Vue 3 composables. Analyze useApi.ts to explain how generic functions enable type-safe HTTP requests, how refs manage request state (data, loading, error), and how readonly wrappers protect internal state. Document the execute function's fetch implementation with try-catch error handling and finally block cleanup. Illustrate how reset functionality enables composable reuse across different contexts. Provide usage examples showing instantiation with specific TypeScript interfaces and await patterns. Explain how this abstraction improves code organization, testability, and maintainability compared to inline API calls. Address security considerations such as error sanitization and response validation. Include guidance on extending this composable with features like authentication headers, request cancellation, or caching. Discuss token efficiency implications when using AI assistants to generate similar patterns. Make content beginner-friendly with clear explanations of reactivity concepts while providing advanced insights into robust API client design.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Performance Optimization rule category. Explain how these rules guide developers toward efficient rendering, bundle splitting, and memory management. Cover key patterns such as lazy-loading components with defineAsyncComponent, using v-memo, and avoiding unnecessary re-renders through proper key usage. Include usage examples demonstrating code-splitting strategies and asset optimization techniques. Discuss integration with build tools like Vite and how rules help interpret bundle analysis reports. Address common performance pitfalls like large payload responses or unwatched watchers. Provide optimization tips for initial load time and runtime efficiency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Examples and Usage Patterns
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Examples section focused on demonstrating proper implementation of the rules in real code. Analyze each example file to extract best practices: show how basic-component.vue follows Composition API conventions, how form-component.vue integrates validation and accessibility, and how useApi.ts implements secure API patterns with Axios. Provide line-by-line explanations of key patterns and their alignment with the rule categories. Illustrate before-and-after scenarios where applicable. Explain how these examples serve as templates for new development. Include guidance on extending these patterns to more complex components. Address common deviations and anti-patterns to avoid. Make content accessible to beginners while highlighting advanced techniques for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Use Cases
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation of practical application scenarios from USE_CASES.md. Describe real-world situations where these rules improve development outcomes, such as building enterprise dashboards, accessible e-commerce interfaces, or high-performance admin panels. For each use case, outline the combination of rules applied, expected benefits (e.g., reduced bugs, faster load times, better accessibility scores), and measurable outcomes. Include team workflow impacts, such as improved code review efficiency or reduced onboarding time. Connect use cases to specific examples in the examples/ directory and relevant rule categories. Provide implementation checklists and success metrics for each scenario.

wiki_catalogs.name: Accessibility
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Accessibility rule category. Explain how these rules ensure WCAG 2.1 AA compliance in Vue 3 applications. Cover implementation details for semantic HTML usage, ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation support, and screen reader compatibility. Include practical examples such as labeling form inputs, managing focus in dynamic content, and creating accessible modals. Document relationships with UI Frameworks rules to ensure third-party components meet accessibility standards. Address common issues like missing alt text or improper contrast ratios. Provide testing strategies and automated checking guidance to validate accessibility compliance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Tools and Utilities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Development Tools section focused on the utility scripts that support rule maintenance and cost optimization. Explain the purpose and functionality of lint-rules.mjs in validating rule formatting and structure, including how it ensures consistency across the rulebase. Detail measure-tokens.mjs's role in analyzing token consumption to help control AI development costs. Provide usage instructions, command-line interfaces, and output interpretation. Include examples of integrating these tools into CI/CD pipelines or pre-commit hooks. Discuss performance considerations and limitations. Address common issues such as parsing errors or inaccurate token counts. Offer customization tips for adapting the tools to specific team workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: FAQ & Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a comprehensive FAQ and troubleshooting guide based on FAQ.md. Structure questions by category (Setup Issues, Rule Application, IDE Integration, Performance Concerns, Accessibility Validation). For each question, provide clear, step-by-step answers with diagnostic procedures and verified solutions. Include error message interpretations, common misconfigurations, and workarounds for known limitations. Address edge cases in rule application and unexpected behaviors in Cursor IDE. Incorporate preventative best practices to avoid recurring issues. Ensure content is searchable and organized for rapid problem resolution while maintaining educational value for understanding underlying causes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Security rule category. Thoroughly explain how these rules prevent XSS, CSRF, and insecure data handling in Vue 3 applications. Cover implementation patterns such as sanitizing user input, safely using v-html, and securing API calls with Axios interceptors. Include examples demonstrating secure authentication flows and protection against prototype pollution. Explain integration with API Integration rules and how they collectively improve application security. Address common vulnerabilities in single-page applications and provide mitigation strategies. Include performance considerations like overhead of input validation and secure coding best practices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contribution Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Contribution Guide focused on how to extend and improve the vue-cursor-rules repository. Cover the entire contribution process from setting up a development environment to submitting pull requests. Explain the rule writing guidelines, including naming conventions, structure, and metadata requirements. Detail testing procedures to ensure new rules don't conflict with existing ones. Incorporate content from COST_PLAYBOOK.md about token discipline and budget-conscious development. Provide clear examples of well-structured rule additions. Address code review expectations and community standards. Include information on maintaining backward compatibility and versioning strategies. Make the guide welcoming to first-time contributors while providing thorough technical guidance.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the State Management rule category focused on Pinia. Explain how these rules promote clean store design, proper state mutation patterns, and effective store composition. Cover implementation details including defining stores with defineStore(), structuring actions, and using getters efficiently. Include usage examples showing modular store organization and cross-store interactions. Discuss integration with Vue 3’s reactivity system and how rules prevent direct state mutations. Address common issues like circular dependencies or over-fetching in actions. Provide optimization tips for large-scale applications with many stores.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reference Materials
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive reference content covering supplementary materials that support effective use of the rules. Organize information from FEATURES.md about supported capabilities, USE_CASES.md for application scenarios, and FAQ.md for common questions. Document configuration options derived from package.json scripts and dependencies. Include detailed guidance from UI_KITS_MIXING.md on integrating multiple UI frameworks like Vuetify, Element Plus, and Quasar within the rule constraints. Structure the content for quick lookup with clear headings and searchability. Address edge cases, known limitations, and workarounds. Provide cross-references to relevant rule categories and examples. Ensure the material serves both quick-reference needs and deeper exploration.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the API Integration rule category. Explain how these rules standardize Axios usage, error handling, and request/response transformation across Vue 3 applications. Cover implementation patterns such as configuring interceptors, defining typed endpoints, and managing loading states. Include practical examples demonstrating retry logic, timeout handling, and authentication token refresh. Discuss integration with Security rules to ensure safe transmission of data. Address common issues like unhandled promise rejections or race conditions in concurrent requests. Provide performance optimization tips such as caching strategies and request batching.

wiki_catalogs.name: Internationalization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Internationalization rule category. Explain how these rules facilitate Vue I18n implementation for multi-language support in Vue 3 apps. Cover implementation details including message formatting, pluralization, date/number localization, and dynamic locale switching. Include usage examples showing translation key organization, component-based translations, and fallback mechanisms. Discuss integration with build processes to optimize language bundle loading. Address common issues like untranslated strings or RTL layout bugs. Provide performance considerations such as lazy-loading language packs and minimizing bundle size impact.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Frameworks
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the UI Frameworks rule category. Explain how these rules guide consistent usage of popular Vue UI libraries including Vuetify, Element Plus, Ant Design Vue, Naive UI, PrimeVue, and Quasar. Cover implementation patterns such as theme customization, component composition, and accessibility compliance within each framework. Include practical examples demonstrating proper integration with Vue 3’s syntax and TypeScript support. Discuss trade-offs between different frameworks and when to use each one. Address common issues like CSS conflicts or tree-shaking misconfigurations. Provide optimization tips for reducing bundle size while maintaining rich UI functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Budget Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Budget Optimization rule category. Explain how these rules promote token discipline and cost-effective AI-assisted development in Cursor IDE. Cover implementation patterns such as writing micro-changes, intelligent batching of edits, and minimizing redundant AI queries. Include practical examples showing how small, focused prompts reduce token consumption while maintaining productivity. Discuss integration with measure-tokens.mjs script for monitoring usage. Address common inefficiencies like overly broad context requests or repetitive explanations. Provide optimization strategies for balancing development speed with AI cost management, especially in enterprise environments.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Analysis of vue-cursor-rules Project

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
Vue 3 Cursor Rules is a comprehensive collection of development rules designed to enhance Vue 3 application development through intelligent automation. The project aims to provide developers with production-ready patterns that enforce best practices in code quality, performance, accessibility, and security.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Deliver zero-configuration, copy-paste ready development rules for Vue 3
- Automate enforcement of TypeScript, accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA), and security standards
- Optimize development workflow efficiency through AI-powered suggestions
- Promote consistent code quality across teams and projects
- Reduce technical debt by establishing solid architectural foundations

### Target Audience
The project primarily benefits:
- Junior to mid-level Vue developers seeking guidance on best practices
- Senior developers and team leads aiming to standardize code quality
- Freelancers and consultants delivering professional-grade applications
- Enterprise teams maintaining large-scale Vue 3 codebases
- Development teams wanting to improve productivity and reduce bugs

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The project follows a modular structure focused on development rules rather than traditional application components. It organizes rules by functional domains such as Vue 3 composition patterns, TypeScript safety, performance optimization, accessibility, and enterprise concerns.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Cursor IDE] --> B[Rule Engine]
    B --> C[Budget Optimized Rules]
    B --> D[Vue 3 Composition Rules]
    B --> E[TypeScript Rules]
    B --> F[Performance Rules]
    B --> G[Accessibility Rules]
    B --> H[Security Rules]
    B --> I[State Management Rules]
    B --> J[API Integration Rules]
    C --> K[Token Discipline]
    D --> L[Composition API Patterns]
    F --> M[Bundle Optimization]
    G --> N[WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance]
```

### Design Patterns
The architecture leverages several key design patterns:
- **Rule-based system**: Configuration-driven behavior modification
- **Separation of concerns**: Rules organized by functional domain
- **Convention over configuration**: Default behaviors require no setup
- **Extensibility**: Modular rule structure allows easy additions

### System Relationships
The rules integrate with the Cursor IDE to provide real-time development assistance. They analyze code context and suggest improvements based on established best practices. The system operates as a developer assistant rather than a build tool or runtime framework.

### Data Flow
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Developer Code] --> B[Cursor IDE]
    B --> C{Rule Engine}
    C --> D[Analyze Code Context]
    D --> E[Match Relevant Rules]
    E --> F[Suggest Improvements]
    F --> G[Developer Accepts/Rejects]
    G --> H[Updated Code]
    H --> B
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `.cursor/rules/` - Primary directory containing all development rules
- `package.json` - Defines scripts for rule validation and token measurement

### Core Modules
- `scripts/lint-rules.mjs` - Validates rule formatting and structure
- `scripts/measure-tokens.mjs` - Analyzes token usage for cost optimization
- Examples demonstrating proper implementation patterns

### Configuration Approach
The project uses a convention-based configuration approach where rules are automatically detected and applied by the Cursor IDE when placed in the appropriate directory structure.

Sources:
- [package.json](package.json)

### External Dependencies
The project itself has minimal dependencies, focusing instead on guiding the use of common Vue 3 ecosystem libraries:
- Vue 3 with Composition API
- TypeScript
- Vite
- Pinia
- Tailwind CSS
- Axios
- VueUse

Sources:
- [README.md](README.md#L65-L74)

### Integration Points
- Cursor IDE integration via `.cursor/rules` directory
- Project initialization through simple file copying
- Rule validation through npm scripts

Sources:
- [HOWTO_Cursor.md](docs/HOWTO_Cursor.md)
- [COST_PLAYBOOK.md](docs/COST_PLAYBOOK.md)

### Component Relationship Diagram
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Cursor IDE] --> B[Rule Engine]
    B --> C[VUE3 Rules]
    B --> D[Typescript Rules]
    B --> E[Performance Rules]
    B --> F[Accessibility Rules]
    B --> G[Security Rules]
    C --> H[Composition API]
    C --> I[Component Architecture]
    D --> J[Type Safety]
    E --> K[Bundle Optimization]
    F --> L[WCAG Compliance]
    G --> M[XSS Prevention]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The project provides comprehensive development guidance across multiple dimensions:
- Vue 3 composition patterns and anti-patterns
- TypeScript type safety enforcement
- Performance optimization techniques
- Accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 AA)
- Security best practices (XSS, CSRF protection)
- State management with Pinia
- API integration patterns
- Internationalization support

### Implementation Highlights
- Production-ready component examples demonstrating proper patterns
- Budget mode features for token-efficient development
- Advanced composition patterns including factories and dependency injection
- Enterprise-grade error handling with automatic recovery
- Accessibility helpers for screen reader announcements and focus management

Sources:
- [basic-component.vue](examples/basic-component.vue)
- [form-component.vue](examples/form-component.vue)
- [useApi.ts](examples/useApi.ts)

### Feature Architecture
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Development
    Development --> RuleApplication: Code Written
    RuleApplication --> Suggestion: Match Rules
    Suggestion --> Decision: Developer Review
    Decision --> Implementation: Accept Changes
    Decision --> Modification: Request Adjustments
    Implementation --> QualityCode: Improved Implementation
    Modification --> RuleApplication
    QualityCode --> [*]
```
</blog>
